description.narrative: National capacity is strengthened in legislation, planning and budgeting for equitable access to essential high impact maternal and child health interventions using REDS Strategy, by end 2016, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased use of services and strengthened good practices for the fulfilment of young child's rights to health, nutrition, protection and school readiness, particularly for marginalised children
